perturbation.original_text: Dolphin agrees to complete its photo-editing services within 14 days of receiving the original digital photo files. The completed files must meet DGT pre-defined standards for finished products;
perturbation.changed_text: Dolphin agrees to complete its photo-editing services within 2 days of receiving the original digital photo files. The completed files must meet DGT pre-defined standards for finished products;
perturbation.explanation: This change reduces the time frame for completing photo-editing services to 2 days. Such a short turnaround time may be deemed unreasonable and could potentially violate labor laws or regulations related to fair business practices, depending on the volume and complexity of the work, especially in states that prioritize fair and reasonable deadlines for contracted services.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of fair business practice regulations or labor laws related to reasonable workload and deadlines; 15 U.S. Code ยง 45 - Unfair methods of competition unlawful; prevention by Commission

perturbation.original_text: No action, whether in contract or tort (including negligence), or otherwise arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, may be brought by Dolphin more than six months after the cause of action has occurred.
perturbation.changed_text: No action, whether in contract or tort (including negligence), or otherwise arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, may be brought by Dolphin more than one month after the cause of action has occurred.
perturbation.explanation: This change shortens the statute of limitations for bringing a legal action to one month. This is likely inconsistent with Nevada's statute of limitations for contract disputes, which typically allows for a longer period (e.g., 4 years for written contracts).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) 11.190 (Statute of Limitations for contract claims)

perturbation.original_text: DGT shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement if Dolphin fails to meet its requirements and material obligation hereunder and only after DGT have given Dolphin written notice of such failure and only after Dolphin has not rectified such failure within 10 days of the notice. Dolphin shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement only after DGT fails to meet a material obligation hereunder and only after Dolphin has given DGT written notice of such failure and only after the DGT has not rectified such failure within 30 days of the notice.
perturbation.changed_text: DGT shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement immediately if Dolphin fails to meet its requirements, regardless of notice. Dolphin shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement only after DGT fails to meet a material obligation hereunder and only after Dolphin has given DGT written notice of such failure and only after the DGT has not rectified such failure within 90 days of the notice.
perturbation.explanation: This modification allows DGT to immediately terminate the agreement without providing any notice or opportunity to cure. This contradicts the principle of good faith and fair dealing implied in most contracts, and the lengthened cure period for DGT places an unreasonable burden on Dolphin. The modification likely violates contract law principles that require reasonable notice and opportunity to cure breaches.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing; potentially Unconscionable Contract Terms
